title: Travis Scott fell on stage and hurt his knee during electric performance at Rolling Loud in New York
text:
He's known for giving it his all during every show.

And Travis Scott was certainly feeling the pain as he fell on stage during the Rolling Loud concert in New York on Saturday night.

The 28-year-old rapper jumped up and landed wrong on his knee in the middle of performing Butterfly Effect at Citi Field in Queens.

Yikes! Travis Scott was certainly feeling the pain as he fell on stage during the Rolling Loud concert in New York on Saturday night

Scott — who is known for engaging with his fans and using the entire stage has his own personal dance floor — barely moved after the injury.

He relayed to the crowd that he thought he broke his knee, but later admitted that nothing would stop him from performing.

'I ain't gonna lie, I think I just broke my knee right now,' he told the audience. 'But this show cannot stop just yet.'

Ouch: The 28-year-old rapper jumped up and landed wrong on his knee in the middle of performing Butterfly Effect at Citi Field in Queens

Scott — who is known for engaging with his fans and using the entire stage has his own personal dance floor — barely moved after the injury and was seen sporting a makeshift knee brace made of tape.

Travis managed to remain front and center for his fans, and played the rest of the show without moving from a center spot.

He then went on to perform Bystanders before closing the night out with Sicko Mode.

'Nothing can ever stop this show,' he assured the fans while sporting a makeshift knee brace made of tape.

Strong: He relayed to the crowd that he thought he broke his knee, but later admitted that nothing would stop him from performing.

He recently told GQ Germany that he's 'gotten so much energy' from his daughter Stormi, who he considers to be a little 'battery.'

'She has shown me so many things that I never understood. I only got it once she was here,' he continued in his interview before saying: 'Fatherhood is the most impactful thing in my life.'

Travis and Kylie Jenner reportedly split just a few weeks ago, but have remained focused on raising their baby girl and keeping a friendship.
description: The 28-year-old rapper jumped up and landed wrong on his knee in the middle of performing Butterfly Effect at Citi Field in Queens.
